intro: Halimocnemis alaeflava, commonly known as the paleleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family, which includes many species adapted to dry environments. The plant is characterized by its sprawling growth habit, with fleshy, lobed leaves that reduce water loss through transpiration. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are typically greenish-white in color and appear in clusters. Halimocnemis alaeflava is well-suited to sandy soils and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats.
